article.headline: Idaho beats Montana 92-87 in 2OT
article.story: MOSCOW, Idaho -- Mike Scott's 3-pointer and Perrion Callandret's two free throws gave Idaho a two-possession lead in double overtime and Montana never recovered, losing 92-87 on Thursday night. The win keeps Idaho (12-14, 7-8 Big Sky Conference) in the hunt for post-season tournament play. Down by five after Callandret's free throws, Jordan Gregory drew Montana within 89-86 with two free throws with 23.6 seconds left, but Idaho's Bira Seck hit a free throw, then Sekou Wiggs added two more. Connor Hill scored 23 for Idaho, Scott had 18, Arkadiy Mkrtychyan 15, Wiggs 12, and Callandret 11. Gregory scored a career-high 36 for Montana (16-11, 12-4). Mario Dunn added 11. Gregory's 24-foot 3-pointer with 9.3 seconds left in OT tied it at 70 to send the game into double overtime. Leading 33-24 at halftime, Montana was up by nine with two minutes left in regulation when Idaho rallied and Scott tied it at 58 with two free throws.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
